title: Between mother and wife, which one is more important for a married man? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which one is more important for a married man? Definitely if his mother is mature, she will tell him to love his wife. She will also love his wife. If his mother and his wife quarrel and the man has to go for his wife. That is because that way his mother is immature. That is because his mother is one of the persons who had shaped his character. And when the man was very young and was in his tender age, he would have believed in so much his mother had told and he would have seen as a towering figure in his life. And so later whatever way he behaves, his mother is responsible. It is an insult on a man to expect a man give importance to one of the persons among his mother or wife. Definitely the mother is in a better position to blackmail him citing all the sacrifices she had done for him. And the worst part is if the man is immature, he will be more trusting his mother if she blames his wife and won’t be kind to his wife. That is because the child part of him is familiar with his mother’s ways but not his wife’s ways. Whatever his mother needs, his mother definitely can’t expect emotional support from him and she can’t show as a child to him. But his wife needs to be emotionally supported by him and that way only his relationship with his wife blooms. His duty is to build understanding and trust with his wife. And definitely it is not necessary for him to build understanding and trust with his mother. What will really happen is the man will give more importance to the more mature woman among these two. But the truth is, if the mother were mature, he will also be a mature person and will take care of his wife.

Why is it a matter of comparison when it comes to mother and wife? There are several other relationships that matter in a guy’s life. There are hardly considered when it comes to measuring his feelings towards them vis-a-vis anyone else. Strange, right? Having said that, women themselves perpetuate this thinking by trying to pull the guy (son/husband) towards them and seeking a bigger part of him. As if he is a possession to be owned. Every relationship has its own place in one’s life. A mother gives life to her son, nurtures him and wishes nothing but the best for him. Her presence and importance can never be measured or diminished. A wife leaves her home and comes to live with her husband, placing all her trust and hopes in him. She leaves behind life as she knows it to embrace life as they envisage together. The husband is her support system in her new environment and she is willing to forge new bonds and reinvent herself to be his partner and companion in the journey of life. She wishes nothing but the best for her husband… her love. The guy sees the love, sacrifices, pains and efforts of his mother as he grows up from a baby to a responsible individual. He keeps reiterating to himself about how he will take care of her when he is capable of doing so. He sees the vulnerabilities of his wife who invests her emotions and hopes in him and seeks to reassure her with his love and support. While the former is a relation he venerates, the latter is the one he seeks to cultivate. Both are beyond comparison as they don’t follow the same trajectory. They have their own space and importance in a guy’s life and intersect only when it comes to loving their common denominator… the guy. The entry of one cannot usurp the space of another. Rather, it should not. The issue crops up when one or both are insecure about their own self and seek to reaffirm their presence by undermining the other one’s presence. This leads to a tug of war with the guy being the ultimate prize. But in actuality, the guy pays the ultimate price by getting divided into two halves and never being able to savour life with the two people who can actually make him happy by being together. No matter how much he tries, he cannot decide who is more important as they both matter to him. Compartmentalising isn’t a easy job particularly when it comes to matters of emotions and feelings. If the women in question deal with each other in a mature manner, the question of comparison will never arise. Both fill in shoes that cannot be filled by the other. They both are loved and significant, just not by the same yardstick. Above all, their relationship with the guy doesn’t need to be compared to be reminded of it’s value. They both love the guy. That’s a wonderful commonality that can make them coexist and bond without seeking to divvy the man. He shouldn’t have to prove himself again and again.

The state of the Married Man becomes complicated when the couple stay with the Parents. I have seen this happen for both my Dad and my husband. They get pissed off and always become a sandwich between Mom and Wife. I am a wife as well as a daughter. But when I saw the situation as a daughter, I always felt my Mom was wrong and my grandma should have a take too. However, now as a wife I realise that the generation gap is making things more complicated. There are a lot of many things that the older generation is not able to understand and accept in this highly sensitive Tech Age. Now I feel, this might have happened with my Mom too. For any human (male or female) parents should come first according to me. However, the wife has also sacrificed so much to fit into your family, adapt your culture, food, and left behind all her comforts for the sake of being with you. If the man feels that his mom has done this too and has put in her best efforts to nurture him, then he should also realize that his wife is nurturing his kid. And this is a cycle. And it also depends on the man and his attitude for being a good son as well as a good husband. There are a lot of divorce cases in Asia which has happened due to the parents interference. However, the older generation should be able to accept the fact that they have lived their life, nurtured their kids, grew them up and now its their turn to take a backseat and enjoy the view. This would make the couple more responsible for getting settled on their own, raising the kids, and the cycle should continue. Every decade is bringing new changes. And the one who is able to survive is the one who can adapt to those changes. One should not have an attitude like "hey, I am older to you so I know things better. Dont teach me!". This worsens the situation. And the misunderstandings continue and never end. As they say, "Your age doesn't define your maturity, your behavior does!"

Which eye is important for you? Left or right!. In a person’s life both the women are important. Mother:— Loves you and support you conditionally.Never takes revenge, even though if you illtreat her.Don't love you based on your economic conditions.Be with you in all difficult times.Wife:— Even though you are not her blood relative, sacrifices her life for you.Even though married you based on your economic conditions, serve you and take care of you until last breath.She needs more love from you, bcuz she has left her family and she cannot approach her family if she faces problem.Even if she feels, her parents are more important: then you cannot have a life partner.After marriage, its your wife who shares your feelings, sorrows and difficulties with you. Even though your mother loves you unconditionally, you cannot share your feelings with mother. Mother loves you because “Blood is thicker than water”. Wife loves you and support you even without blood bonding. A newly wedded wife needs her husband's support, because she is wedded to him. You have to take side whoever is right. Your family may find her wrongs because they feel her as a outsider. Your mother may be good to you and love you. But she may hate your wife and torture her. Moreover, you need to spend rest of your life with wife. If you fall ill, its your wife who will look after you(mother may be aged and unable to look after as her health condition will not be good). Now you decide, as a married man whom do you approach for your needs? Whom do you want to share your responsibilities? Whom do you want to cook for you and look after thouse the household works. Don't you expect your wife to support you ahead of her parents? Ask your mother whom does she want her husband to select between her and her Mil. You will get the answer. Don't scold both of them in front of each other. Assure them that you love and support both of them. Mother is like a education or student life. Wife is like a job or professional life. You need education to fetch a job. Both are equally important. During childhood and upto a certain age education is more important and your student life is quite liberal and happy. But professional life expects you to be more perfect and matured. Because in student life your decisions may not affect others, whereas in job your wrongs will cost you more. You cannot be student all the time. In the age of earning you cannot keep on studying. You have to choose job for livelihood and so on. Hence both are important at particular stage. Anyway please be good son as well as husband. Don't hesitate to spend for your mother in old age. Same time give importance to your wife too. Don't abuse or neglect either of them to appease other one. You have to assure your wife that you stand by her in her difficulties. Don't treat her as a outsider. Moreover don't believe anyone's words too blindly.

Well by all means your parents I.e father and mother both than comes your wife and then comes your children because if your parents would not have been there then you would not have been there and then comes your wife. It is most important to pay your debt first and then spend for future investment I.e your wife and children. They are your future investment which may or may not repay. You can only found out that after say 5- 15 years as the case may be. But your parents are the one who have toiled hard and enriched you with their sweat and blood. They are the one because of which you are what you are today & if they cannot be on the top of your priority list than nobody else can not even GOD himself/ herself. You all can say that I am very backwards in my thought. You may be right also. But if you are not putting your parents at top of your priority list even before your wife and children even though it is causing you a lot of hardships than you can never be a worthy son and are a spineless creature to say the least and if your wife expects herself to be put ahead in priority vis-à-vis your parents than I can only say this that you are most unfortunate to say the least. The same implies for your wife and her parents vis-à-vis you yourself per say. If the above thoughts are not seconded by your wife it is better not to marry at all in first place else you as a son and husband will always suffer at hands of your wife and mother because of their infighting. Those who say wife is the one who is the most venerable part in this whole gambit of marriage are totally wrong it is you as a son/ husband who is the most venerable of the whole conundrum called marriage because he will suffer no matter what either from wife's accusations or her mother's. So compatibility between wife and mother is more important than husband and wife when it comes to family and by family I doesn't mean husband and wife I mean husband wife and their parents. I may be old fashioned to say the least but if a family is to rise it is only this way please.

Well..one lady has played a very important role in your past and another lady is going to play a very important role in the future. Also, we always tend to look forward and our consciousness flows forward.For instance, when your kids are born, your complete focus shifts on them.You automatically give them more importance than your parents.And it was the same for our parents when we were born. They gave us more attention than their parents.And the same thing happens with you. The question of who is important is very tricky. It arises only when either the mother or wife or both try to show their dominion on the son/ husband. And then conflict arises. A lady leaves her family and comes to her husband's place so she is important. She needs to be given that importance. A mother definitely deserves all respect and importance but she would be possessive for her son if she has had an unsatisfied married life. She has not got that importance from her husband and she tries to fill that void/ shallowness by getting attention from her son, this happens especially in India. I have seen this cycle going on and on. And thereby more dissatisfied women are there in society. And this actually defeats the complete purpose of marriage. A man is born to be united with his wife and not his mother. Therefore, considering the institution of marriage, a wife is more important not because of anything else but for the reason that she is going to be your soulmate and the person,who would share her everything with you. Your mother's soulmate is your father not you. Add to this, this tug of war enters the bedroom too and disturbs the sexual lives of the couple. I would rather suggest that men give importance to thier wives and thereby create a society, which is full of happy, energetic, blooming, women. Thanks

A wife is more important, a mother has fulfilled her duties for you now she needs to relax and let your wife lead these duties…a mother liked to dress you up earlier now it should be your wife's chance….you are an adult man, you can't share everything with your mother now but because your wife is your soulmate you can share everything with her, you can't go on romantic dinners, adventures trips, etc with your mother but you can do it with your wife, you and your wife’s life together has just started and it's super important that you two spend a lot of time together so you can build a really strong relationship, your mother should also give you that space which indian mother's mostly usually don't. Mother is important too… you take care of her, you continue loving her, you give all the respect she requires, you make her laugh, spend time with her, go out with her to the places she likes…but don't ignore your wife, you give some decisions to your mother to make, you give some decisions to your wife to make…a mother should understand that her son now needs to live rest of his life with his wife…she should also respect their new relation, their privacy, and their decision. She should sometimes arrange dinners for the couple, ask them to go for a movie, dinners etc just like the daughter in law cooks food for his family, visit his relatives, participates in all the family traditions - touch thier feet, listen to them, respect them. I understand that a mother might have sacrificed a lot but I think almost all the women do that for their kids..and infact this new woman in thier family might do the same for her kids…it is a cycle…love needs to be bloom between the couple, every person around them should help them make this happen

although your question is exposed to a greater audience world over I would answer it with a statement saying you cant choose between your eyes even if you loose one the person that s going to loose the eye and get hurt is you, You are the ultimate sufferer with that said,different societies have different ways a kid becomes an adult in most modern western society which is more nuclear in structure accepting and open and with more opportunities its not uncommon for a kid to have seen parents getting divorced remarrying or have different partners etc etc the responsibility of becoming independent financially and emotionally comes very early in life for someone like that they wouldn't have developed a deep bond with their parents, Like wise the responsibility of the parent would end once the kid crosses the teen hood that doesn't mean they don't love each other as parents/children it means they have the emotional strengths to choose what is better for them as individuals.moving forward when you take Asian, Arab or to some point traditional European cultures the emphasis is on a joint family and family values where elders are respected and young ones are taken care of no matter the age it carries a sense of belonging to someone or something it revolves on the concept of a large family as a speer protecting each member where every individual counts and is provided for in such an atmosphere an individual becomes close and bonds with the people around him or her even nuclear families born out of such large groups still retain such values and people form these kind of societies have a deeper bond with their parents and the parents still consider their children's as their babies no matter the age. with the two above examples you can make out when two individuals who emerge out of such societies and marry a completely unknown individual(might have dated but doesn't mean you have lived with that individual) how they would deal with different situations what emotions they harbor or what hierarchy they would emphasis on individuals in their life's. beyond this there is also the psychological fact of some people who are totally disconnected from others in life it may be a social thing or a personal nature you cant change evolution of emotions, nature has its own ways. all the rest of the things like love respect bla bla bla are all mumbo jumbolets face the fact you being on this planet is a gift from your parents you cant repay it back no matter what you do its not something which can be quantified the same goes true to the sacrifices a women does after she marries you and stays with you till the end if she stays with you that is. The main focus for a married man should be to gauge who is right and who is wrong and how well can he convince the wrong person that they where wrong without hurting their feelings if you can master it early in life once you are married the better if not your life turns an emotional cesspool very hard very fast.

I don’t know if it’s exactly a matter of being “more” important. It’s more that things change because you’ve made choices. Hopefully, as many have said, a mother (and any other parents) have raised their kids to be decent people who are capable of functioning in the world on their own. When you get married, you are promising to be with someone else. You’re starting your own family even if it’s just the two of you. Legally, that changes things, such as spouses becoming the default next of kin. Things will be different emotionally, too; you love your spouse differently than you love your parents. I think it’s important to love and support one’s parent(s), but when you’re married, your priorities do change. Hopefully there’s a way to balance them, because being put in a place where you’d have to decide between a wife and mother (or husband and father or whatever combination) is horrible. All that said, I do think that barring extenuating circumstances, the spouse is a higher priority.

The wife is considerably more important. The wife is the person you’ll be spending your life with, celebrating triumphs, surviving losses. She’s the person who will bear your children and probably take the lion’s share in raising them. She’s the person who will support you in all of your endeavors. The two of you will sink or swim together. Your mother played a key role in your life, helping you to become an adult, protecting you when you were a child, guiding your moral and intellectual development and she deserves your love and consideration. But her role is largely in your past. Her job, so far as it concerns you, is pretty much done. If circumstances force you to decide between the two of them, it seems to me that the right choice is obvious. Do what you can to honor your mother. But devote yourself body and soul to your wife.

One gives birth, the other gives life. In Indian families this problem arises the most and how women are treated is to be blamed. Girls before marriage are not given much importance by their parents as they marry and belong to another family. This kind of partial treatment will make her set expectations of love and importance from her husband and husbands family. When such girls are not welcomed properly in husband’s family problem arises as they become more insecure.On the other hand many wives do not get required care and attention from their husbands which makes them set expectations from their son. ( Son is mine and he will treat me better than his father).Above are the two major factors which make a woman more possessive towards his son or husband. Well there are other factors too. Priority should be given to wife as you start a new life with her and she will be your companion for the rest of your life. She will be mother of your child. Also the one who takes care of you in your old age. It’s important that you love and keep her happy to lead a harmonious life. If wife is not happy it will reflect in your kids too.Every child wants to see their mother happy. Priority should also be given to mother as well but not as much as wife, parents stand a circle outer after marriage . Parents health and well being should always be taken care. Problem arises when a mother takes control of everything of a married son. Such interferences will make wife feel she is secondary and is not important.Such things should be communicated gently.But most of the mother’s do not comprehend it properly and create more problems as they think son has changed after marriage. If the intervention is too much that you cannot concentrate on your life then the only option is to stay separate.

Yes and No. It depends on the situation. On the one hand, generally speaking, no one loves you the way your mother does. Divorces are sadly all too common these days and eventually exes move on and form new relationships. On the other hand, for example, if your mother and wife clash - and each separately tries to give you a version of her story, insist the other be present otherwise you won’t hear her out! I’ll give you two examples My ex-mother-in-law wanted her son to marry a wealthy woman - which I am not, hence her dislike of me. She told my ex-brother-in-law that whilst standing on the ladder hanging a curtain, I pulled her off and she tumbled to the floor. When he confronted me, I brought the ladder inside and politely asked her to climb it. She’s very short, only 4 feet and suffers from severe arthritis, meaning she can’t lift a leg to climb the first step! I turned to my BIL and quietly said, “Never mind she can’t climb the ladder, given her age (76 yo) she’d have broken bones and/or bruises. If you still don’t believe me, please call the police, they’ll sort out this mess,” You could hear a pin drop. He didn’t utter a word and left soon after. After he left, she turned to me and said, “I said no such thing”. (!!!) She apparently tried this trick with my ex, but he didn’t believe her! One woman I know dislikes her MIL so much that she’s forbidden her to cuddle her grandkids. The MIL hasn’t told her son for fear of reprisals and only cuddles them in secret. In a nutshell, use your best judgement, every situation is different.

we should not confuse their rights. On account of, each of them have their position.Islamic teaching emphasizes many times about mothers respectingThe fourth Imam says: و أما حَقُّ أُمِّكَ، فَأَنْ تَعْلَمَ أَنَّهَا حَمَلَتكَ حَيْثُ لا يحتمل أحدٌ أحداَ، وأعْطَتْكَ مِن ثَمْرَةِ قَلبِها ما لا يُعطي أحدٌ أحداَ، ووَقَتْكَ بِجَمِيعِ جَوارحِها، ولَمْ تبال أن تجوع وتطعمك، وتعطش وتسقيك، وتعرى وتكسوك، وتضحى وتظلك، وتهجر النوم لأجلك، ووَقَتْكَ الحَرَّ والبَردَ، لتكون لها، فانك لا تُطيق شُكرها إلّا بِعَونِ اللهِ وتَوفيقه. "It is your mother's right towards you that you should remember that she carried you in her womb for several months and nourished you with the sap of her life. She employed all her essence to keep and protect you. She did not care if she herself went hungry, while you were fed to satiety; or to go thirsty herself, while your thirst was quenched; or to have no clothes, while you were well-covered; or to stay in the hot sun, while you were sheltered; She ignored her sweet sleep and tolerated the pain of sleeplessness for your sake. She protected you against the heat of summer and cold of winter. She bore all that pain in order to have you, and you may have her. You should know that you are unable to thank your mother appropriately unless God helps you and grants you the favour and ability to repay her.Mother’s order is respected even in comparison with God's command, is when an obligatory divine order comes across a mother's prohibition, on the condition that the action concerned does not fall within the imperative and obligatory injunctions such as daily prayer, or the fast of the month of Ramadhan.We have order to respect mother even after her DeathThe Fifth Imam says: "An offspring may be benevolent to his parents during their life­ time, but he may not repay his debt to them after they die, nor pray for their salvation, and forget them altogether. In such a case, this offspring will be included by God in the category of those who misbehave towards their parentsOn the other hand, husband has some duties toward his wifeA man, who is supporting his family, should know that a woman is also a human being like a man. She also has desires and the rights of freedom and life. Marrying a woman is not hiring a servant, but it is a selection of a partner and a friend who would be able to live with for the rest of one's life.We can count some rights for husband1- Be More Loving and Caring To Your WifeWe have some narration about it:Whoever is our friend, expresses his kindness to his spouse more”. –Imam Sadiq (AS) – (Bihar al-Anwar, vol 103, p 227)‘’The more one becomes faithful the more one expresses kindness to his spouse’’.– Prophet (PBUH) – (Ibid, p 228)“The words of a man who tells his wife, ‘I love you truly’, should never leave her heart” –Prophet (PBUH) – (Shafi, vol 2, p 138)2- Taking Care of your Wife:3- Respect Your Wife:Imam as-Sadiq (a.s), quoting his father, stated: 'Whoever marries, must respect his wife'.""The Prophet of Allah (S) stated: 'Whoever respects a Muslim, Allah would pay him his own respect'.""The Prophet of Allah (S) also stated: 'None would respect women except the magnanimous ones, and none would insult them except the ignoble ones.' In addition, the Prophet of Allah (S) stated: 'Whoever insults his family, would lose happiness in his life'."4- Be Well-mannered:

Choosing one over the another is not a wisest thing to do. Both of them, plays an important role in men’s life. If you, in any case make a choice. You’ll get yourself in further trouble. Women don’t forget!! They’ll remember this that you chose the other one over them. And, you’ll suffer the consequences later in form of taunts or behavioral changes. If there’s a problem going on between the women in your life. The best you can do is to take a step back, and let them resolve the issue. Try to exclude yourself from such question. Or simply say “both of you are important/dear to me. I can’t choose one over the another”. Upon insisting, just walk away, or show a sign of exhaustion, and tell them how disappointed you’re with the question. Don’t put yourself in a position where you can’t get out of easily! You need to just remember that a woman gave birth to you, fed you, taught you, and gave you the happiness who you call mother. And, the woman you share your problems with, wants to grow old with, have kids with, wants to make team with, and call her yours is the one you call wife. Everyone has their place in men’s heart. But, being just is what it takes to be a man. Good luck!

Mother is the one who brought you on this planet…took pains and raised you. She should be respected loved and cared for all your life. But you married a women. She chose you to create a world with you and also to bring children with you on this planet. Both of have very unique and fabulous roles in mans life. But if at all at any point you are required to choose I would say choose your wife. The other day I just attended one small get together of some family members and distant friends and relatives. My wife introduced herself with her full name (including my name) with all pride and smile in her eyes. So did my mother introduced her name with my fathers name with smile and pride. Wife has left her home name sometimes even career to be with you. Appreciate that. I know at times in todays age, when divorce rates are so high this concept would be hard to believe. But i belive this thought of prioritizing itself creates rift among partners. Mans priority his wife and so does a wifes priority is her husband.

No. You should chose your wife over your mother. If your mom is right then yes back her up, however you need to be careful how you word it. say you are religious. . . The bible tells you to leave your parents and cleave to the wife when you get married. I would choose the wife over the mom, because you are supposed to spend your life with your wife by your side, and not your mom by your side. figure out if you want to stay married, or not and work along those lines. You should respect your mom because you only get one of those. but if you want a relationship with your wife to continue then you need to make sure that you are not always taking your mother’s side. remember : you chose to marry your wife. which means to me at least that you love her and respect her and want to spend the rest of your life with her. you can’t do that if she feels that she is the other woman and your mom is the woman that you are with.< yes I said that correctly

There are certain things that just can’t be quantified meaningfully. A mother is for life no matter what. One cannot get another one. The same is true for a husband. Both can be replaced. But a good wife, like a good husband, can make life the best it can be—and when that happens, he or she is the most precious being in the world. Also, one day, the mother will die and life will go on for another 20, 30, 40 years with only the wife or the husband. Then, it will be another world again. And again, it cannot be quantified. Both are important in their own ways and a good mother and good husband or wife would hopefully not be jealous of each other—they each fulfill different functions. But reality can be rough and some mothers can be awful as can be some wives or husbands. Then, it’s probably better to leave both of them and travel the world and send them a postcard: “Wish you were here! ha ha ha!” No return address. Hopefully, you don’t have to go to such extremes!

Their is a thing called balancing between both world. You have responsibility towards your wife and as well as your mother. Choosing your wife over mother is not wrong because now you have your own family to take care of and parents need to understand now their sun universe can not rotate around them. If your mom was not over possessive, extremely intrusive and too critical such scenario of choosing would have not occurred. I am not saying your wife is angel but she is an outsider who has solely came believing you, and what ever her behaviour is based on the stimuli. ( It’s a reaction to your mother action) At the moment, all you need is to make a safe distance so that situation can be diffused and you can understand your wife and mother expectation and try to make them come to term. I am asking to choose wife over mother is because moms are often very much possessive for their boy and as they get married n their priority changes at sub conscious level they get threatened and jealous.. it’s human nature. And some distance at the moment will help her rethink to consider bridging gap… and your wife will listen to you because you choosed her and she is assured you will always be for her. I apologies if I hurt your sentiment.

The word love belongs to mothers first. How come a balanced man can keep any one above his mother. A son places himself one with his mother and expects her to be pro son. A wife has no direct biological relationship with her husband though some marry their sisters’ or cousins’ daughters .Love is a phenomenal word it exists only when a quality relationship is maintained.Love with wife does not qualify as divine. It is mostly convenient oriented or developed from forced dependency like children becoming a common thread to stay together. Mother -son relationship is natural and deeper than wife’s relationship. A wife can be replaced not a mother.I am not making a biased or pro mother assessment here. It is unfair to compare as mothers will be departing at one stage and wives may live with their husbands longer . Love has more meaning to it. Each and every human being if matured will love mothers beyond horizons. Husbands are committed to accept wives and develop love with them whereas mothers share the same genes.

Today, many married men are caught in this situation due to constant bickering between Mother-in-Law and Daughter-in-Law. A very delicate issue but must be attended to intelligently by all concerned. Men and their family members must first realize that a girl is leaving her comfort zone (parent’s place) and settling down in a new family. So, it becomes essential that she is given sufficient time to get to know the practices and adjust. All the family members must show her affection, kindness, understanding and never be critical about her or her family members. Mother has nurtured her son and knows about him completely. Intelligent MIL will give ample privacy to the couples, never interfere nor impose her views rigidly. DIL must learn to respect elders even if she disagrees with them, develop a positive attitude, be cheerful and assert herself without offending. This is a great relationship management exercise and all can gain great experience if they can manage the relations and live happily despite the differences amongst them. Wife is definitely important part of man’s life and loving Mother knows this and will never want her loving son to suffer. Despite best efforts if joint family living becomes impossible, nothing wrong to set up a separate home for the young couple. However, hatred must not be developed and keep the contacts alive by frequent meetings according to convenience.

Their both important in different ways. But your wife is the one you should be making the most effort with, she would be no 1 on your priority list. You grew up left home and now chosed to live your life with your wife so continue on this journey together and share a beautiful life together. That doesn't mean you love your mum less, be there for her when you can but your mum should understand that you can't come running whenever she wants. Your priorities have changed and that's your wife and kids. They need you the most.

Oh Man! Who told you mother is more important than wife? Is Sun more important than moon? Is water more important than air? Are eyes more important than ears? Each one on the universe is born with a purpose and has its own unique function. So no one is superior or inferior. It is we, who make them prior, according to time. Mother can’t play wife. And wife can’t play mother. Mother is usher, while wife is companion. Mother is from eternity, wife is to the eternity. Mother is ray of light in darkness, while wife is your support to hold. Mother is school/institute, while wife is job. Always remember, never compare two beings in your life unless you have to give up on any one of them.And if you ever face a situation, where you have to either give up on your mom or wife. Never give up your mom. Cause, how much your mom loves you, may be your wife will love your son the same. Not you.

The answer to this question will and can be best given by a Man himself. We men are very good at making a person feel very special when we are with them. So whenever you are with your mother make her feel the special lady in your life and when you are with your wife make her feel the special lady in your life. But when it comes to choice never choose no matter how bad the situation gets you should never choose one because you would never be able to do justice to any one of them. Your mother and your wife both have made bigger sacrifices for you than you have made for either one of them. Your wife left her mother for you which you can't right now and your mother well there is no need to explain this. So, try not to choose but when there is no other option then assess the situation look who is at fault. If both are right in their own way then you should lean towards your mother because a mother's love is greater than that of a spouse. I hope it helped. May Allah guide you.

To be honest I think of God as most important first. Before I knew God I loved my husband above all. In a sense he was my God. When I began developing a relationship with the father, through the son, and led by the spirit….I was afraid putting God first would hurt my marriage. I came to learn quickly that loving Him first allowed me to love my husband even better. My love towards him became more pure and healthier. If that makes sense. So with that I don’t feel like we should look at a relationship with our spouse being more important than our relationship with our parent or vise versa. All relationships we have are equally important in my view. They are all different, but all very important just the same.

Your wife. Your mother since the day you was married became your extended family. There is nothing wrong to try a help your mom out to a point. But you need to be there for your wife 110% of the time. God tells us that He comes first. Then your spouse, then your children then mom & dad. You should always honor your mom & dad but your wife comes before your mom. No matter what!

Generally speaking no. From the moment you were born you started moving away from your parents. Yes, they will likely always be some part of your life. You respect and honor their kindness, work and sacrifice. But you are an adult now, that part of your life is ended. Your life is your own now. Your highest priority is your family, not your parents family. Your wife is your partner, your companion and your highest advisor. She should be an integral part of your life. She is the present and the future, your mother is the past. You have connections with your family, as does she. Respect those connections, and ask them to respect the bittersweet truth that their work is done.

It is not matter of who is Important between wife & Mother but its matter of reasoning & understanding who is right & wrong . Any how as a Mother you have to bow & handle her carefully even she make mistake . Its your responsible & duty to support her in her old age even still their is a mistake as at this age you can't change her mindset but you & wife can tune to adjust with situation. You can't in this life pay parents debts at any cost. Only you & wife has to mould in your behavior rather changing her. Only sujestion you can give to your mother & not order regarding what is right & what is wrong with considerable moral values.

If a man puts his mother above his wife, his wife will suffer. His marriage will suffer. It may lead to divorce. This is why the Bible says that a man and a woman shall leave their parents and cling to each other. It does not mean you won't ever see your parents again but that you are now making your own relationship and home. Equally a woman who is putting her parents before her husband - whether it be either socialising or confiding - damages her marriage. Some mother-in-laws have a difficult time with this concept. The husband must tell his own mother that his wife comes first. Same for the wife.

One should never quit honoring one’s mother. This is, after all, one of the 10 Commandments. However, the highest importance and allegiance is to ONE’s SPOUSE. The Bible says in Genesis 2 and reiterated since in the New Testament and Christian literature. That marriage is DEFINED as a Man LEAVING his father and mother and CLEAVING to his wife. And that the TWO become ONE FLESH. That is as intimate and clear as possible. By FAR, all husbands first priority, after God, is TO THEIR WIFE.

It's a question that can be answered only by you. Ask this question other way around instead, Between her mother and husband, which one is more important for a married women? If you think her mother is more important than her husband , then your mother is important than wife. If you think her husband is more important than her mother , then your wife is important than mother. Mother and wife, both are different phases of life for a man. A man has to love and protect his wife no matter she is right or wrong. A man has to see that his mother is not disrespected by any one, not even wife.

Without any doubt it's your mom. Just try to find out. Come From Sunny and humid weather full of sweat you have a headache. Your mom will always care for you bcoz she is your mom. And that moment your wife may ask you to go for shopping no matter whatever you are going through. You can never underestimate love of mom or dad. Love of mom is uncomparable. Never ignore your mom.You can get many girls like wife but mom is only one you can never get another mother. She is beloved. Leave your wife never ever doubt or leave your mom she will always love and care for you.

According to me there should be no need to give more importance to anyone person. There should be no priority because both are important in your life then why are you asking that who should be more important. What if I ask you that who is more important in your parents, your father or your mother? I am sure that 90% people will say that , “ Both are important for me”. Then why you are asking such kind of questions. Giving more priority to one means you are easily neglecting other person and as well as she is not as much as important in your life. So stop giving priority to someone. If your mother and wife both are important then there should be balance between both and no priority should be given to anyone. If you think that someone is more important than other then it means other person is an option for you.

If I ask you if you will choose your right eye or left eye what would be your reply? The same works here. A mother is the one woman who has carried you for 10 months breaking several bones for you, staying hungry and so many sacrifices that you are in such a position. A wife is someone who has come with you with the trust you wouldn’t let her down. Left her entire family to make your family as hers. There is no choice here. You should be a capable man of defending both and make them comfortable with each other that you wouldn’t be in a tight spot as to whom you need to choose.

Whom does a married woman love more - Her father or her husband? It's wrong to ask a man whom he loves more. He loves both - his wife and mother equally, just that the love he has for both the women is radically different. His mother is there with him since birth, so naturally he will love her no matter what - that's human nature. And his wife is his partner and someone who will be with him (in most cases), even after his parents leave him. There is no comparison between the love of a man for his wife and mother. You should never ask your man this question under any circumstances - just be happy for the love you're receiving… :)

Mother. The woman who gave birth to you and cared for you for years as you were growing up. The woman who loves you more than anybody else, no matter what you do or what you become. The woman who gives and gives to you, never expecting much in return, other than your love. When she grows old and feeble, she will need your care, just as she cared for you when you were a baby and feeble. Will you abandon her to an Old Folks Home instead? As for your wife, well, she might leave you for reasons that your mother would never leave you. Divorce rates are high all over the world.

Your wife, unless you intend to have children with your mother. Your mother had 18+ years to guide you to become the person you are. After you are married, you and your wife are partners in life and you must support your wife, even against your mother, if necessary.

Hypothetically wife is more important as your mother has her husband to take care of her but for your wife you are the only person to rely upon in this world. But in real life both are equally important because ignoring either of them will affect your life equally badly.

I have five sons, three of whom are in serious relationships. They should worry about making their wives happy, more than making me happy. That being said, I can't remember one occasion. With any one of their three girlfriends where a situation of “either/or” has occurred. Maybe I just happen to be incredibly lucky, and wound up with good daughters in law, or maybe because I want my children to have healthy relationships, and I do what I can to support my childrens’ partners, always keeping in mind that I have not managed to raise an Angel. Not one of my kids is wearing a halo. When my kids are wrong, I say that, too.

OMG , its a difficult answer. In men there is a issue they love one women in there life which is there Mom and I’m sure this thing goes wot you too as you must love your parents also. but they try to manage it as both wife and mother are important to them and in all this they get tormented if they don’t manage it perfectly. As on one side there is a women whom he loved and she raised him and on the other hand there is a women who he loves also at a same level as his mother(Talking about the intensity not the wrong way). As wife and mother have to think also about the issue also.

Why are you comparing both relations. If you want to comapre and want to know my opinion, i think both are equal in terms of importance. In childhood, mother look after her child. After marriage, wife care her husband. Mother cooks delicious food. Wife try to cook same delicious food. Mother understand you but wife want some time for it. if a woman (mother) hates other woman (wife) or vice versa, man (son/ husband) suffers most.

That can or would depend on what your marriage goals are. Some people see marraige as an opportunity to make a life that is as separate as possible from all others and some see it as an opportunity to live a more inclusive and wholesome family life. In one case the man might make his wife the center of what he is working to build and in another case the man might see both his mother, in laws, and wife as one single extended and personal family in which case he might value everyone according to their role and contribution plus be desirous of benefiting everyone equally depending on each person’s needs within each individual relationship and the relationship as a whole.

Wife and Mother both are important, as they have different yet plays a crucial role in a man's life. First, why a mother wants his son to marry? She wants him to find a soulmate who can take care of him for life. This should be the answer but No, In Indian society the answer is they want a maid, cook, and caretaker for life. There are so many expectations of inlaws from a girl that this whole thing turns into a fight. Now, the son is in a dilemma who to support, and then who is more important to you question arises. I feel that mother and wife should be friends first, their relationship should not be like a competitor. Here, a son can play an important role and how he handles the situation. This is my personal opinion.

Obligatory Not Married statement. My mother is more important than any woman in my life. I will leave all the “she gave me life” cliché bullshit. Your mom raised you and made you into the man you are today. You owe her a lot more than you realise. Unless you grew up without one, biological or otherwise, then I'm truly sorry for you. As far as wives go, my uncle is on number six. SOs come and go like the seasons and tides.

Indian guy, i guess? Well here's the thing: they're different. Mom nurtured you during childhood and helped you become an adult. Wife is your partner. She won't nurture you like a baby, but will create your family and help nurture it. Have you ever compared between sister and mother or brother and father? They have different place and they don't seem to fight about it. Patriarchy gave women just one option to access power- lady of the house. Apparently, most Indian households have this mom vs wife thing because of this. And they look upto the man of the house, the leader, to choose his favorite who can rule. We dont need that in modern world because women have more options and ambitions. Even if they ask you to intervene, don't (unless either is straight up abusive). They're adults capable of handling the fight without supervision of a man. For that man, both are family, with different roles.

Both women are in important in different ways in a healthy relationship when a mother's son becomes a man the relationship changes to adult child and mother mom will always be mom but when a man gets married his wife comes first and kids if there are any If a man is not mature enough to put his wife and family first and make sure that his wife is shown respect at all times and there are no healthy boundaries in place for in laws or family he is not ready to be married

FIRST of all try to understand that there is no competition between anyone. how being a son i stop my love feeling emotion for my mother and being a husband I also love my wife . Mother is first important part of anyone life especially boys and wife is second important person . If both don't try to displace their position to get more attraction, both are secure and feel secure However feeling of insecurity will spoil the life peace. I love my mother so much and can't live without my wife. Let you decide what position you deserve in my life and what you get surely get your answer

In America the wife is more important then the mans mom because the man and wife have a contract called a marriage license ! The mom and son do not have a legal binding contract like a marriage license ! And beside he is going to have sex with his wife and not his mom ! His wife comes first and then his mom and then his mom in law ! Thanks

Honestly I can't believe this is even a question. A man loves his wife and mother in completely different ways. When a man chooses his wife he is making her the number one woman in his life. His mother will always be special to him and have a special place in his life but she should NEVER compete with a man's wife. The wife needs to know she is his number one in your life. If you are lucky your wife and mother will get along great. I absolutely love my mother in law. She is an amazing woman. She is extremely important to both my husband and I. We have never had any issues either. We each have a special place in my husband's heart. If you really don't know who is more important then maybe you shouldn't be getting married.

Encounter this problem myself, and I come to the best solution (from my point of view, of course) You just need to take care of your mother (and father) in all aspects (financially, mentally etc) since they no longer work, maybe sick and needs attention. You need to make sure they are getting all they need, since that’s what they did to you all your life. But when it comes to your marriage, you and your wife are the only decision maker. Whatever problem or question arise in your day to day marriage, no one else should interfere. That’s my 2 cents.

I can tell you that both have their unique place in your life and deserve to be loved and nurtured. But, it will have little effect because in your heart you know this already. But you just do not realise it. So, let me tell you this instead. This is a highly immature question. Though it is a very popular narrative in most Indian households. Trying to compare and put hierarchial bands to your own family members is the beginning of disorienting manipulation. Why do you want to pit your wife and mother against each other, unless you want both of them to be fighting for your attention? Grow up and get a life. And please, do something for your self esteem first.

As a very senior, experienced man in our society, I must caution every young married man that your only answer is both are important. And you better never say anything different in public. And why? To prevent your eternal misery. But there is a catch: You say wife to your wife (in private) and say mother to your mother (in private). But you never should say mother-in-law to your mother-in-law because she would never believe you; you would tell her your wife. And what is the real answer? They’re both important—haven’t you learned anything.

You should go with both, your wife and your mom together. Now, if I was in your place and I had no option but to choose only one, undoubtedly I will choose my mom. Because she took care of me all through her life and I would definitely call it love, care and sacrifice, I should not be blind on that. Just for a lady who has been with me for a few years, I cant forget my mom who is with me since my birth.

By definition, a married man must have a wife, or spouse. Married men don’t really need mothers. If the mother died after the wedding, a typical married man could live quite happily for his remaining days without her. Possibly much happier.

looking for a hard and fast rule of “Who should I listen to? My mom or my wife?” the Bible doesn’t offer an answer. A mother and wife aren’t meant to be set against each other in a competition for the man’s loyalty or love. If there is a conflict between the two, there is no spiritual law stating that the man must “take sides” with one or the other.

This is the aspects of life. Their roles are very important in our life. Mother role was very much important before marriage to nurture child and making mature and capable adult person while role of wife is so important to carry his life and family ahead. It will be 1st choice not to compare both, both are important person in life. If you want to be successful and happy in life, never try to compare. There is relation distance theory in social management which need to follow to live better life.

This answer applies only to Christian marriage. Part of your vows are to cleave from your parents and become one with your spouse, so from a religious standpoint, for Christians, it would be the spouse. From a pragmatic standpoint, it depends. If the wife turns out to be a toxic person, and is trying to alienate you from your family and friends wrongly, then that answer is reversed. This isn’t a hypothetical, I have seen this.

Why choose? Just ensure that you are not letting the person down in front of other. Mom is mom - she is the reason we are in this planet. Wife - the closest person she have in the family is you - she is not in her own home n left behind everything. Just think of you staying in in- laws place for days. So, don’t choose - just ensure they are treated well in front of each other.

Wife. Full stop. When you get married, your parents and siblings are no longer your immediate family - your wife is. This doesn’t mean that you have to agree with and back up everything she does, especially if she is in the wrong. If you want to know what happens when a man chooses his mother over his wife, go to google and search “Baby Center DWIL board” and read the stories.

We cannot compare who is most important because both are played their role and with out mother and wife a man is nothing.Mother cant play the role of wife where wife cant play the role of mother.Wife spent her life with her husband and she live for him.Mother who teach son how to live and she is make him good persons.But today's when wife enter the life many of them forget about the mother ,it is not faith.

I always wonder why one has to choose between the left eye and the right eye! A mother today is a wife to someone while a wife today will be a mother to someone! Each of them play their own roles in our lives! How can one even expect to choose one of them? If a man is smart enough he can very well give both of them their places in his life and respect too! This all depends upon the man’s ability!

Each in their own time. A good mother should raise her son to be a strong considerate man and them let him go. A good wife should recognise the loyalty the son has to his mother. The wife and the mother should be friends, afterall they both love the same man. It shouldn't be a competition.

Believe me you are more important than either of them ,so take care of yourself keep your self happy don't try to make either of them happy as it is very difficult to please women ,help your mother and obey your wife at least pretend.

Mother is always highly important.You should not compare your wife with your mother as mother is incomparable but it does not mean that you will torture your wife listening your mother.Your mother has no right to torture your wife through you or directly whatever.

Ideally, both have equal place in life , so there can't be any comparison, mother at this age deserves more of respect and care and love should be for wife. It is for the man how to create a balance between someone who brought him into this world and someone who will bring his next generation in this world.

Well all I can say is look in the Bible , however if I were married and my mother or husband didn’t get along I’d sit them both down so they can sort their differences out , and if that still doesn’t work and we were all in the same house I’d probably move out get my own place , you can only do so much and try and make them see eye to eye . But if my mom didn’t like him then of course she’s got her reasons but , all in all it’s up to me on whom I choose to be with. That is exactly why a lot of relationships are ruined because of parent interferences.

The mother should come first of course. His mother was there for practically his whole life, a wife will come and go. They’re gonna have arguments and divorce but you can’t get rid of your mother. It’s a pretty easy choice actually.

Sigh. When you marry, you vow to place your spouse above all others. That includes your parents. If my husband had chosen his mother over me, we would have divorced. Why would I live with someone who did not see me as his partner and as the most important person in his life?

It really depends who you love more… But if you want to get really pragmatic the mother of the husband is going to die soon whereas finding a wife and raising offspring is the husbands purpose in life.
Both should be given same value if man want to be happy always. If he become bias for any one then he has to loose one. Both has different value in man's life,one can never replace another.
Only one word for this MOTHER

The Bible says a man “shall leave his mother and father and shall cleave unto his wife.” When you get married, your spouse comes first, 100%! That doesn't mean you don't continue to love and honor your parents! Of course you do! And in a healthy family relationship, there shouldn't be a conflict there.

A2A Why do some people have to ask this? Love them the same, one like a mother, the other like a wife. Neither should require any status above the other, but they both have their place. If either steps out of that place gently (or firmly if required) put them back into it…..If they are both doing their roles well, there should be no problems.

When a man married, he leaves his father and mother. If you are a Christian and own a Bible, turn to Genesis 2:24. It reads(King James version), “Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and hold fast to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.” Also, Ephesians 5:31 addresses your question. Hope this helped.

A husband should never choose his mother over his wife. The word says when a husband finds a wife he leaves his mother and father's house and clings to his wife. You married your wife not your mother. In the same boat that doesn't mean disrespect your mother.
His wife if he's got any sense he has to live with her so she’s the boss lol
Wife, because her vagina is open for business, but not your mom’s. Also, assuming you picked the right one, you’re more obligated to her, that’s how the cycle continues. You don’t go backwards.
No. Nor should he ever be put in such a predicament where he would have to choose one over the other.
Once you marry you need to cut those apron strings, the most important person to you should be the person that you sleep with and that hopefully will only be your wife.

Both should be very important in your life. U shouldn't have to choose between the two. Thats a bad situation. I'd stand and tell either one that is against me. Accept my choice i love you both or gotta go
Both relation having their own importance but husband should give importance to mother . mother is the one who brings him to this world
The wife. She is the person you live with now, the person you have chosen to share your life with. Cut the apron strings, dude.
Wife.
The saying is happy wife happy life. Both are important but wife comes first . A mother should know this and a wife should teach this as the same is for a daughter.
That's a difficult question because they're Both important but in different ways.
Mother.
WIFE
